response_text: Got it â€” here are simple, reliable ways to get live transcription while streaming or watching videos, from easiest to more advanced:  ğŸ”¹ Browser-based (fastest setup)  Google Chrome Live Captions  Works for any audio playing in Chrome (YouTube, Netflix, Zoom, Twitch, etc.)  Turn on: Settings â†’ Accessibility â†’ Live Caption  Offline, real-time, very accurate (English best)  Microsoft Edge Live Captions  Same idea as Chrome, slightly better multi-language support  ğŸ”¹ Desktop apps (system-wide audio)  Otter.ai  Live transcription while audio plays  Best for meetings + videos  Free tier available  MacWhisper (Mac)  Uses Whisper (very accurate)  Can transcribe system audio with setup  ğŸ”¹ Built-in OS tools  Windows Live Captions  Windows 11 only  Transcribes all system audio in real time  Very solid accuracy  Apple Live Captions  macOS / iOS  Works across apps (Safari, video players, calls)  ğŸ”¹ Advanced / power-user  OBS Studio + Whisper plugin  Real-time captions for streams or recordings  Best for creators, not casual viewing  âœ… Quick recommendation  Watching videos casually? â†’ Chrome Live Captions  Meetings + streams? â†’ Otter.ai  Want system-wide captions? â†’ Windows Live Captions / Apple Live Captions  If you want, tell me:  your OS (Windows / Mac / mobile)  language(s) you need  where you watch (browser, VLC, Zoom, Netflix, etc.)  Iâ€™ll narrow it to the best single setup for you.
